subject: RE: [junit] How to test private member variables?
msgSnippet: Have you looked at JUnitX plugin? http://www.junit.org/news/extension/index.htm#JUnitX Maybe, this is what you are looking for. Selva. ... From: Lothar
messageBody:
Have you looked at JUnitX plugin?
http://www.junit.org/news/extension/index.htm#JUnitX

Maybe, this is what you are looking for.

Selva.

-----Original Message-----
From: Lothar Kimmeringer [mailto:junit@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 24, 2003 2:26 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] How to test private member variables?


On Wed, 23 Jul 2003 20:41:39 -0000, jxingtang wrote:

>How do I verify that command line arguments are
>extracted corrctly to the right private member variables?

Write a method
public String getParamValue(String paramName, String[] args) and write
tests for this method.

Your private members can then be initialized with
private int myPrivateInteger = getParamValues("port", prgArgs); and
there will be no need to access private members.

Another approach might be the use of test-cases defined as inner
classes.


Regards, Lothar

--
